Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.machine

Class ThreadSingUnoMachine

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.machine.ThreadSingUnoMachine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ThreadSingUnoMachine extends Object implements Runnable
Class ThreadSingUnoMachine

A runnable class representing an automated process that monitors whether the human player has declared "UNO" after having only one card left. If the player fails to declare "UNO" within a randomized time interval, a penalty card is drawn automatically.

This class is typically run on a separate Thread to continuously observe the game state without blocking the main game flow.

See Also:

  • UnoEventListener

      public void run()
      The main execution method for the thread. It periodically checks if the human player has only one card and hasn't declared "UNO".

    • hasHumanOneCard

      public void hasHumanOneCard()
      Checks if the human player has only one card and has not declared "UNO". If so, applies a penalty and notifies the listener.
